block.p: Sarah Ann Sulick, a daughter of Eileen Ryan Winnick of Westport, Conn., and George Sulick of East Haven, Conn., is to be married this afternoon to Stanley Myint, the son of Milica Myint of Belgrade and Aung Myint of Yangon, Myanmar. Wally Meyer, a justice of the peace, is to officiate in Westport.

The bride, 30, and the bridegroom, 34, work in London, where she oversees acquisitions for Renaissance Films, a production company, and he is an associate and banking specialist at McKinsey & Company, the management consulting concern.

Sarah Ann Sulick, a daughter of Eileen Ryan Winnick of Westport, Conn., and George Sulick of East Haven, Conn., is to be married this afternoon to Stanley Myint, the son of Milica Myint of Belgrade and Aung Myint of Yangon, Myanmar. Wally Meyer, a justice of the peace, is to officiate in Westport.

The bride, 30, and the bridegroom, 34, work in London, where she oversees acquisitions for Renaissance Films, a production company, and he is an associate and banking specialist at McKinsey & Company, the management consulting concern.

The bride graduated magna cum laude from the University of California at Los Angeles and received a master's degree in cinema and television from the British Film Institute and the University of London.

Her father, who was the winemaker at Crosswoods Vineyards in North Stonington, Conn., until 1990, is a landscaper for LaFlamme Services in New Haven. Her mother works in New York as a preparation coach for people making television and other public appearances, including authors, physicians and executives. The bride is a stepdaughter of Carol Roper and of Stan Winnick. Mr. Winnick is the vice president of Bonn-Fiore Inc., a New York building contractor. Ms. Roper teaches the fifth grade at the Pine Point School in Stonington.
Mr. Myint graduated from Belgrade University and received a doctorate in physics from Boston University. His mother is a freelance book translator. His father is a retired mining engineer.

The couple met in 1996 at a class on French cinema at the French Institute in London. Afterward they made a date to see ''The Umbrellas of Cherbourg,'' fell in love and never returned to complete the film seminar.

WEDDINGS Correction: July 9, 2000, Sunday A report last Sunday about the wedding of Sarah Ann Sulick and Stanley Myint misspelled the name of the company at which the bride's stepfather, Stan Winnick, works. It is Bohn Fiore, not Bonn-Fiore.
A report last Sunday about the wedding of Sarah Ann Sulick and Stanley Myint misspelled the name of the company at which the bride's stepfather, Stan Winnick, works. It is Bohn Fiore, not Bonn-Fiore.
